qas.question: What virtue guides Christians in their understanding of God?
According to Christianity, who is the "One"?
What is Charity to a Christian?

answers.text: manifestation of the pure love of Christ

qas.question: What should man's nature be centered on?

plausible_answers.text: he learns to rely less on an intellectual pursuit of virtue and more on an affective pursuit of charity and meekness

qas.question: What happened within a man as the image of God decreases?
What does not guide Christians to acknowledge that are are nothing without God?
Who do Christians not consider to the "One"?
Who did not create, sustain, or guide man?
What should man;s nature not be centered on?

context: As the image of God grows within man, <b4_0>he learns to rely less on an intellectual pursuit of virtue and more on an affective pursuit of charity and meekness<b4_0/>. <a0_0><b5_0>Meekness<a0_0/> and charity<b5_0/> guide Christians to acknowledge that they are nothing without the One (<a1_0><b6_0><b7_0>God/Christ<b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/>) who created them, sustains them, and guides them. Thus, man then directs his path to that One, and the love for, and of, Christ guides man's very nature to become centered on <a3_0><b8_0>the One<b8_0/><a3_0/>, and on his neighbor as well. Charity is the <a2_0>manifestation of the pure love of Christ<a2_0/>, both for and by His follower.
